solution.text:
A square's diagonals bisect each other perpendicularly, and their diagonals are equal too.
Thus \(OP = OQ\).
Also \( \angle POQ\) is \(90^o\), thus \( \triangle POQ\) is an isosceles right triangle.

content.text: In a square PQRS, the diagonals meet at the point O. The triangle POQ is
